snippet: Mr. Trump said his supporters wanted him to run as a fiery outsider rather than embrace the mellower approach Republican leaders want.
abstract: Donald J Trump claims he has mandate from Republican primary voters to eschew more traditional, mellower and more inclusive approach to campaigning in general election; strategists say Trump's plan carries many risks, but they also note that enthusiasm of his supporters could decline if he makes significant change in his tone or policies.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and MAGGIE HABERMAN

lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump said his supporters wanted him to run as a fiery outsider rather than embrace the mellower approach Republican leaders want.

headline.main: Donald Trump, Bucking Calls to Unite, Claims ‘Mandate’ to Be Provocative
headline.print_headline: Pushed to Unite, Trump Declares He Has Mandate
